Affix

The subnavigation on the right is a live demo of the affix plugin.

To move your affix block inside some parent, just add position: relative to that parent. 
$('.affix-selector').affix()

Properties

Name Default Description
spy @$el.data('spy') or 'affix' To automatically find affix elements and make them active.
offset 5 In px. Affix's block offset from top.

Methods

Inside each method to affix element use @ or this in js. Class instance always stores in data attribute of the affix element @data('kit-affix') or this.data('kit-affix') in js.
Method Default Description
start

Activate affix
stop

Deativate affix
beforeactive undefined

Set a function to call it before start affix. If it returns deferred.promise(), then affix will not start till deferred.resolve(), and woun't start at all if deferred.reject(). You can just get data with $.ajax() for your affix block.

$('.affix').affix
	beforeactive: ->
		d = $.Deferred()

		console.log @
		# The affix dom element will be in the log
		# so you can add something like
		@addClass '_do_something_'

		console.log @data 'kit-affix'
		# The instance of Affix class will in log

		# Do something here before start affix
		# in this case it will start after 2 seconds
		setTimeout ->
			d.resolve()
		, 2000
		# End of your code

		d.promise()

onactive undefined

Set a function to call it after affix started.
beforeunactive undefined

Call this function before affix stopped.
onunactive undefined

Call this function after affix stopped.
